DataElement.preferredName: Proton beam Radiation Therapy Availability Institution Identifier Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The institution code related to the availability of proton beam radiation therapy at a site involved in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Proton beam Radiation Therapy Institution Availability
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to the availability of proton beam radiation therapy at an institution.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Property.preferredName: Proton beam Radiation Therapy Institution Availability
Property.preferredDefinition: No value exists.:Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.:An established society, corporation, foundation or other organization founded and united for a specific purpose, e.g. for health-related research as, a literary institution; also, a building or the buildings occupied or used by such organization.:The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

An established society, corporation, foundation or other organization founded and united for a specific purpose, e.g. for health-related research; also used to refer to a building or buildings occupied or used by such organization.
The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the code that uniquely identifies an institution.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: groups, institutions, or clinical facilities that conduct clinical research or tests, or analyze clinical data.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
